items.title: Mid, smallcap indices gain up to 2% in early trading on tariff talk hopes
items.description: The broader markets rebounded from the previous session's sharp selloff as bargain hunting and a broader recovery across Asia lifted sentiment amid hopes of US tariff negotiations

items.title: Nifty Realty breaks 3-day losing streak, rises over 3% led by Brigade, Prestige, Godrej Properties
items.description: Shares of Godrej Properties jumped by 6.5 percent after the company reported its highest-ever bookings for Q4 and FY25

items.title: Titan Company: Will the financials glitter?
items.description: The company continues to see strong demand for jewellery, despite the sharp increase in gold prices. The market shift towards the organised segment is also beneficial for large organised jewellery companies like Titan

items.title: Should investors bet on banking stocks as credit growth moderates?
items.description: Growth in personal loans has fallen off the cliff while growth in gold loans has surged

items.title: Trent: What should investors do after a disappointing Q4?
items.description: The SSSG, a key performance parameter, is showing moderation over the past two quarters

items.title: Godrej Consumer: Volume revival, stable margins on the cards
items.description: Under-penetrated categories, rural expansion could unlock growth

items.title: Stock of the Day| Container Corporation of India| A steady compounder for core portfolio?| Mkt News
items.description: Container Corporation of India or Concor is the largest container freight services provider in the country with a revenue base of almost Rs 9,000 crores. To strengthen its foothold in the domestic and international markets, the company has outlined a capex of over Rs 8,000 crores, spread over the next 3-5 years.

items.title: Agri Picks Report April 08, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of rabi crops in Telangana was at 7.6 million acres (1 acre = 0.4 hectares) as of Wednesday, up 13.2% on year from 6.7 million acres sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: M&M shares gain 2% as it incorporates arm Mahindra Advanced Technologies
items.description: During FY25, M&M’s market share from 10.79 percent to 12.34 percent, while peers like Tata Motors, Hyundai Motor India, and Maruti Suzuki India saw moderate contraction

items.title: Titan shares jump over 6% as revenue rises 25% YoY in Q4 business update
items.description: Titan's eyecare segment saw 19 percent rise in Q4, supported by healthy contributions in both revenue and customer base

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares up 4% on Rs 2,210 cr order win from Defence Ministry
items.description: Bharat Electronics Share Price | The company has signed a contract with Ministry of Defence valued at Rs 2,210 crore (excluding taxes) for supply of EW Suite for Mi 17 V5 Helicopters of Indian Air Force

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex up 690 pts, Nifty around 22,400; India VIX down 9%
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: HDFC Bank, BSE Limited, TCS, Reliance Industries, Trent are among most active shares on the NSE. All the sectors are trading in the green with media, PSU bank, consumer durables, healthcare up 1 percent each. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices up 0.5 percent each.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their selling on sixth day on March 7, with selling equities worth Rs 9040 crore, however, Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) turned net buyers as they bought equities of Rs 12122 crore on the same day.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei jumps 6%, rebounds from 1-1/2-year low on US tech boost
items.description: All 33 industry sub-indexes of the Tokyo Stock Exchange saw gains, with the banking index leading the charge, soaring 11% to become the top performer.

items.title: Dow, S&P 500 end wild session lower, Trump digs in on tariffs
items.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 349.26 points, or 0.91%, to 37,965.60, the S&P 500 lost 11.83 points, or 0.23%, to 5,062.25 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 15.48 points, or 0.10%, to 15,603.26.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Kotak Mahindra Bank, Bajaj Finance, GMR Airports, Chambal Fertilizers, PNB Housing, and others on April 8?
items.description: The trend is expected to remain favourable for bears, but some rebound can't be ruled out, considering the significant fall in the past few days. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Titan Company, Bharat Electronics, KPI Green Energy, M&M, Brigade Enterprises, Lemon Tree Hotels in focus on 8 April
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 8 Apr: Stocks like IL&FS Engineering and Construction Company, Titagarh Rail Systems, Cyient, Genesys International Corporation, Manappuram Finance, Infonative Solutions, and Spinaroo Commercial will be in focus on April 8.

items.title: Bulk & Block deals: HDFC Mutual Fund picks 0.56% equity in Cyient on April 7
items.description: Genesys International Corporation had Florida Retirement System selling 2,25,192 shares at an average price of Rs 547.13. Data shows that this translated to 0.6 percent equity in the company.

items.title: Wall Street trades lower as Trump threatens China with steeper tariffs, markets near bear territory
items.description: The market rout is also raising fears of forced selling, as funds scramble to raise cash to meet margin calls. The CBOE Volatility Index, or VIX, spiked to 50 on Monday — a level typically associated with extreme market stress.

items.title: Stock Market BLOODBATH | Nifty & Sensex Crash in One of the Worst Trading Days of 2025
items.description: Markets went into meltdown mode as U.S. President Donald Trump’s retaliatory tariffs sparked panic selling across global exchanges. The Nifty 50 and Sensex crashed over 3 percent in intraday trade, wiping out more than Rs 13 lakh crore in investor wealth before partially recovering. Payal Tiwari Sharma explains the top reasons behind the market sell-off today.

items.title: Futile to predict future, stick to asset allocation dharma, says Kotak's Nilesh Shah amid market turmoil
items.description: According to Shah, large-cap stocks are fairly valued and deserve a neutral allocation. But any correction should be seen as an opportunity.

items.title: FIIs dump Rs 9,040 crore worth of shares; DIIs step in with biggest buying since Feb 28
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.63 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 1.96 lakh crore worth of shares.

items.title: Bloodbath on Wall Street: S&P500 enters bear market, Dow Jones down 1,300 pts amid trade war fears
items.description: If the S&P 500 closes down 4 percent or more on Monday, it would mark the third consecutive day of such a steep decline — something that hasn’t happened since the depths of the Great Depression in 1933.

items.title: Metal index snaps three-day slump; Tata Steel, JSW, others rise up to 2% on China stimulus hopes
items.description: Investors had sold off metal shares on worries over a possible US recession and the implications of a global trade war. However, reports of China considering a stimulus and the weakness in US dollar has likely helped metal stocks stage a recovery.

items.title: Nifty Bank attempts rebound after tariff turmoil and ahead of MPC outcome
items.description: The volatility seen around bank stocks also comes amid anticipation of a rate cut by RBI’s MPC, which is set to announce its decision on April 9.

items.title: Bank of Maharashtra shares jump 5% on strong Q4 business update
items.description: Bank of Maharashtra's total deposits grew by 13.4 percent on a year-on-year basis, reaching Rs 3.07 lakh crore
